nl: Prove that if $R$ is an integral domain and $x^{2}=1$ for some $x \in R$ then $x=\pm 1$.
lean:
∀ {R : Type*} [CommRing R] [IsDomain R]
  {x : R} (hx : x^2 = 1), x = 1 ∨ x = -1
candidate: ∀ {R : Type*} [CommRing R] [IsDomain R] (x : R) (h : x^2 = 1), x = -1 ∨ x = 1
imports:
import Mathlib

open Fintype Subgroup Set Polynomial Ideal
open scoped BigOperators
